definition:
The *wheel graph* of $n$ vertices $W_n$ is a graph that contains a cycle
of length $n-1$ plus a vertex $v$ (sometimes called the *hub*) not in
the cycle such that $v$ is connected to every other vertex. The edges
connecting $v$ to the rest of the graph are sometimes called *spokes*.

$W_4$:

$$\xymatrix{
  & A \ar@{-}[d] \ar@{-}[ddl] \ar@{-}[ddr] & \\
  & D & \\
C \ar@{-}[ur] \ar@{-}[rr] &   & B \ar@{-}[ul]
}$$

$W_6$: $$\xymatrix{
  &   & A \ar@{-}[d] \ar@{-}[drr] &   &   \\
E\ar@{-}[rr] \ar@{-}[urr] &   & F &   & B \ar@{-}[ll] \ar@{-}[dl] \\
  & D \ar@{-}[ur] \ar@{-}[ul] &   & C \ar@{-}[ul] \ar@{-}[ll]&   \\
}$$
